projectGridLines.title: Analytics - Sentimental Analysis of Product Reviews
projectGridLines.description:
Description: Develop model to evaluating words in different product reviews in order  to define sentiments and opinions which may be favorable or unfavorable in polarity. This is a classification in which the classifications are either binary (optimistic or pessimistic) or multiple (happy, angry, sad, disgusted, etc.). 

Skill sets: Excel , Python (Preferred)

Expected learning: Understanding of supervised learning and basic NLP

projectGridLines.title: Data and Analytics (DnA)
projectGridLines.description:
Description: DnA advises clients and help on analytics execution for promoting value creation. Project will be around helping clients in divestitures and acquisitions, and value creation through Gen AI

Skill sets: Exposure to several tech stacks across GenAI, Python, automation, Alteryx, Cloud, UIPath, and scripting

Expected learning: Good experience in value creation through technology

Specific courses required for project execution GenAI, Python, automation, Alteryx, Cloud, UIPath. Corporate Finance and Macro Economics Microeconomics, Financial Engineering, Econometrics + Math I + Math II and Math III

projectGridLines.title: CEL Pursuits
projectGridLines.description:
Description: CEL Pursuits advises EY Partners with sector points of view, deep financial and functional expertise from publicly available documents, towards generating actionable business development analysis.

Skill sets: Strong knowledge of financial ratios, analyzing financial statements, company filings; Knowledge of strategy frameworks

Expected learning: Good experience in value creation through technology

Specific courses required for project execution GenAI, Python, automation, Alteryx, Cloud, UIPath. Corporate Finance and Macro Economics Microeconomics, Business writing, Business strategy, PowerBI, Affinity for one or more of the following sectors: Consumer products & Retail, Life Sciences, Healthcare, Industrials, TMT and Energy; Financial Engineering, Econometrics + Math I + Math II and Math III
